X.i.4.D.3.a
.
Obtaining Proof of U.S. Residency
Obtain satisfactory evidence that the claimant resides in the U.S., such as a
driver’s license
current lease or purchase agreement, or
utility bill.
Notes
:
A Post Office box mailing address in the Veteran’s or survivor’s name does
not
constitute evidence of lawful U.S. residency.
A Veteran who died while outside of the U.S. for less than 61 consecutive days will be considered to have been residing in the U.S. on the date of death.
